query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 S’ïo avessi le rime aspre e chiocce, 2 come si converrebbe al tristo buco 3 sovra ’l qual pontan tutte l’altre rocce,
query.error: **English:** 1 If I had harsh and hoarse rhymes, 2 as would be fitting for the dismal hole 3 over which all the other rocks jut out,
query.result: 1 Sy’m eus an reemow aspra ha hwek, 2 kepar ha bos dhegys dhe’n trys boos, 3 war an moy a-ugh an remen rees,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 io premerei di mio concetto il suco 5 più pienamente; ma perch’ io non l’abbo, 6 non sanza tema a dicer mi conduco;
query.error: **English:** 4 I would express the essence of my conception 5 more fully; but since I do not have them, 6 I am led to speak not without fear;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 ché non è impresa da pigliare a gabbo 8 discriver fondo a tutto l’universo, 9 né da lingua che chiami mamma o babbo.
query.error: **English:** 7 for it is no undertaking to be taken lightly 8 to describe the bottom of the entire universe, 9 nor for a tongue that calls for mother or father.
query.result: 7 rag nyns yw entrepris dhe vos gans gab, 8 dhe dhiskriva an fond dhe’n oll univers, 9 na dhe’n tavesow a lever mamm po tas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Ma quelle donne aiutino il mio verso 11 ch’aiutaro Anfïone a chiuder Tebe, 12 sì che dal fatto il dir non sia diverso.
query.error: **English:** 10 But may those ladies help my verse, 11 who helped Amphion to enclose Thebes, 12 so that the telling may not be different from the fact.
query.result: 10 Mes an gwregow hyn re beu gans ow gerdh 11 a dhyskas Amphion dhe gevra Theb, 12 rag na vo an gwrians dyffrans dhe’n ober.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Oh sovra tutte mal creata plebe 14 che stai nel loco onde parlare è duro, 15 mei foste state qui pecore o zebe!
query.error: **English:** 13 Oh, above all, wretchedly created rabble, 14 who are in the place where it is hard to speak, 15 may you have been sheep or goats here!
query.result: 13 Oh, a-ugh dhe bub, pleb anfurvys, 14 ow th’y’th yn le unn le mayth kovsoweth, 15 my a veth ev owth peth ow zeb!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 16 As we were down in the dark pit, 17 far below the giant’s feet, 18 and I was still looking up at the high wall,
query.result: 16 Avel mayth owth yn-nans an pow sordh, 17 a-ugh dhe ves an gew orth ughella, 18 ha my a welas dhe voya ughella,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 dicere udi’mi: «Guarda come passi: 20 va sì, che tu non calchi con le piante 21 le teste de’ fratei miseri lassi».
query.error: **English:** 19 I heard someone say to me: “Watch how you step: 20 go so that you do not tread with your feet 21 on the heads of your wretched, weary brothers.”
query.result: 19 kovsoweth owth dhe “Gwel marth owth pass: 20 kov mayth, mar nas owth camm orth dha ves 21 dhe bennow an dha vreuderow trist.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Per ch’io mi volsi, e vidimi davante 23 e sotto i piedi un lago che per gelo 24 avea di vetro e non d’acqua sembiante.
query.error: **English:** 22 Therefore I turned and saw before me 23 and beneath my feet a lake that, because of the ice, 24 seemed to be of glass and not of water.
query.result: 22 Rag henna'm troas ha'm gwelas ow kledhes 23 ha danow tra'm treus lyn a'gawra, drehevys 24 avel gwydr ha na dhowr yth esa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Non fece al corso suo sì grosso velo 26 di verno la Danoia in Osterlicchi, 27 né Tanaï là sotto ’l freddo cielo,

query.result: 25 Nyns yw gwella’y avon war an norvys 26 Danow yn Osterlicchi, 27 na Tanaï dan an ebron sel,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 com’ era quivi; che se Tambernicchi 29 vi fosse sù caduto, o Pietrapana, 30 non avria pur da l’orlo fatto cricchi.
query.error: **English:** 28 as was there; for if Mount Tambura 29 or Mount Pietrapana had fallen on it, 30 it would not have made a crack at the edge.
query.result: 28 ages ovel a hemma; rag gemmyn Tambernicchi 29 po Pietrapana a veusist kewsys war’n-y, 30 ny veusist gwres oll mes un krik war y bord.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 E come a gracidar si sta la rana 32 col muso fuor de l’acqua, quando sogna 33 di spigolar sovente la villana,
query.error: **English:** 31 And as the frog sits croaking 32 with its snout out of the water, when the peasant woman dreams 33 of gathering ears of corn,
query.result: 31 Ha kepar ha bos ogas an ranon 32 gans y fri yn-mes an dowr, pan yw hi ow sonja 33 a-gas spigla an vilones,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 livide, insin là dove appar vergogna 35 eran l’ombre dolenti ne la ghiaccia, 36 mettendo i denti in nota di cicogna.

query.result: 34 liv, bys dhe’n le mayth an gonar, 35 ovel an scouthow trist y’n an jea, 36 ow tos ow dens kepar noten an sigon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 40 When I had looked around me for a while, 41 I turned to my feet and saw two so close together, 42 that the hair on their heads was mingled.
query.result: 40 Pan o jallen ow tos ow gweles a-dro, 41 y troas ow tra’m treus, ha’m gwelas dew a veu 42 ow tos ow blew an pennow kemmyskys.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
